resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
Everything was working fine, then at approx 4.30 pm GMT, when I tried to test App on iPad mini, I got error Failed to install on device. I have tried another App (which previously was working), same error.  I created a new mobile App project (called Test), tried to deploy it to my device, same error.  I think I had just accepted updates for Appcelerator Studio and was wondering if this is the cause?
Error log output:[ERROR] :  Failed to install app on device (0xe8008018)
[ERROR] :  Project failed to build after 57s 167ms
[ERROR] :  Failed to install app on device (0xe8008018)
TRACE  | titanium exited with exit code 1
ERROR  | Error: ti run exited with error code 1
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Users/aideengibson/.appcelerator/install/4.0.2/package/node_modules/appc-cli-titanium/plugins/run.js:84:66)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:129:20)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1074:12)
fields.summary: iOS: Apps fail to install on device with error (0xe8008018)

comments.body: [~aideengibson@yahoo.co.uk] if this is a bug please provide Test case, steps to reproduce and full information of your environment, other wise, please post your question in community.appcelerator.com

[~aideengibson@yahoo.co.uk]
Hello, We are going to track this issue using your ticket. Since this has been witnessed by others, it doesn't seem specific to iPad. Please forgive the title edit, but I wanted to make sure the impact wasn't minimized by it being listed as a single form factor.
Have not been able to reproduce the issue. No feedback from reporter. Closing.
